title: Playing video on Google Drive stops
content: When playing videos on Google drive, it intermittently stops. On another browser it works fine. The issue persists with hardware acceleration disabled and in safe mode. It happens in full screen and apparently when buffer health falls under 30s. When the video stops, if I exit full screen sometimes the video resumes in a lower resolution and if I enter full screen again it keeps playing in low resolution.

title: Printing at Reduced Scale Cuts Off Page
content:
I have an issue where Firefox is cutting off the lower half of each page (blank) when I print with reduced scale. It is an issue that only occurs in Firefox—I have tried another browser. I have tried three printers and it causes the issue on all of them. The issue occurs on all web pages I have tried. I have reset the print settings in Firefox, run Firefox in troubleshooting mode, and refreshed Firefox.

Print preview will show the pages correctly with reduced size, but when printed, the bottom half of each page is blank. However, in print preview, if I change the settings to only print the first page, the preview will then show the first page with the bottom half missing.

I am wondering if this problem is caused by the latest Windows update. That is the last change to the computer I am aware of before this printing problem occurred.

Anything else I can try to resolve this issue?

title: Send tab to device doesn't respect "private" status
content:
I open a "New private window" in Firefox.

I right-click on it and choose "Send Tab to Device". I choose a device and user where I'm already running Firefox and logged in as the same user. FWIW, both devices are Windows PCs with Win 10 fully patched and Firefox fully patched.

I get a notification on the destination device and open the tab.

All fine, except that there seems to be no guarantee that the tab which appears on the destination machine will be in a private window. Sometimes it appears in a private window and sometime it appears in a standard window.

I really want to be sure that when I bounce a private tab from one device to another, it stays private.

Is there any way to get certainty?

title: How to use Firefox with Windows's RunAs?
content:
Firefox 90, running at Windows 10 Pro.

Trying to run several Firefox instances simultaneously within one desktop, but as different users. All users are local Windows accounts. Machine isn't in any domain. Local administrator privileges are available, if needed.

RunAs works as it should on Firefox exclusively in one case: if no instances of Firefox are running atm within given user desktop. If instance is in place - Firefox getting launched as the same user as already running instance. Heck, even if I try to launch a new instance just via double-click on firefox.exe.

Every different-user-instance is supposed to use its own set of Firefox profiles stored within local user's %appdata%, so no profile corruption is expected.

How to run several instances of Firefox as applications of different users via RunAs?

title: Cut and paste no longer works with Google Translate on linux
content:
This problem has been around since the latest version of the old version, and has carried across into the new version. Ctrl+A, Ctrl+C and Ctrl+V no longer work with Google Translate on linux. I have tested in other browsers and it they all work fine. Firefox on Windows also works fine, this problem seems specific to linux.

When you press any of the Ctrl combinations it simply deselects everything and moves the cursor to the end of the text. Mouse works, but it's not practical if you are cutting and pasting all day long.

Site: https://translate.google.com Firefox version: 89.0.2 (64-bit) OS: Ubuntu 20.04

Google Translation is critical to my work so my current solution is I no longer use Firefox. I hope that someone knows of a quick fix, or if it's a bug it's easy to fix as I'd hate to permanently move away from Firefox for something like this.

Thanks!

title: Version 90.0 broke Print Preview and Shrink to Fit.
content: I've already found the solution, but wanted to share that Version 90 created a problem with Print Preview and Shrink to Fit. Uninstalling Version 90 and re-installing Version 89 fixed the problem. With Version 90 the Print Preview function (which I love) didn't work properly. When I try to Shrink to Fit any page, the first page shrinks, but the second page isn't pulled into the first page. Also, there's missing information on both pages. If there's another solution so I can use Version 90, please tell me. If not, and Mozilla is doing away with Print Preview (and Shrink to Fit), I'll have to do away with Mozilla Firefox. Sorry, but that's the main reason I use Firefox over Chrome. Perhaps I can find another browser to do what I want. I hope not though.
